Showers early then partly cloudy overnight PERIOD Low around 50F PERIOD Winds S at  to  mph PERIOD Chance of rain  PERIOD

Updated November     pm



Approximately  highschool and college students walked out of classrooms and marched through the streets of downtown Seattle yesterday rallying for education and protesting the Bush administrations plans for war in Iraq PERIOD

About  UW students rallied in Red Square before converging with other schools in the Seattle area at Seattle Central Community College PERIOD There students demonstrated their collective opposition of the Bush administrations plans for what they called a preemptive unilateral war in Iraq PERIOD

They called for betterfunded and moreaccessible schools with chants such as  drew explicit chalk drawings and broke a bombshaped pinata with books inside PERIOD

According to UW junior Emily Reilly who organized the local march the breaking of the bomb symbolized the call to end the funneling of billions of tax dollars to weapons of war and the call to ensure that everyone in the United States has access to higher education PERIOD

 said Reilly PERIOD 

Several Seattle high schools and colleges participated in the nonviolent march as part of a nationwide oneday strike PERIOD It was coordinated by the National Youth and Student Peace Coalition NYSPC an organization of  student groups that came together in response to the Sept PERIOD   attacks PERIOD

The coalition which named the protest Books Not Bombs Stop the War Against Iraq linked student protests against war in Iraq with a call for betterfinanced schools PERIOD

More than  high schools colleges and universities in the country participated declaring March  a national day of student resistance PERIOD

The protest began at  p.m PERIOD Protesters marched to the beat of drums yelled chants like  and carried signs and banners to Westlake Center under the watchful eye of the Seattle Police Department PERIOD A full force of police officers mounted on bicycles and motorcycles escorted the protesters through the city and blocked off major intersections PERIOD

The heavy traffic caused by the demonstration annoyed many commuters who responded with disgusted looks PERIOD However many onlookers from the streets and inside buildings cheered in support of the protesters PERIOD

At the end of the march students lay on the ground in front of the entrance of Westlake Center to represent the impending death toll in Iraq PERIOD

UW junior Allison Barrett cut class to voice her opinions and to show that young

people are concerned PERIOD
